ATTENTION

The texts in this section were the first written for History Tracers, during a period when we did not yet have a complete understanding of how to teach effectively to a broad audience. The content presented here has since been reviewed and rewritten to make it more dynamic and accessible in other texts within the "Sciences" section.

Prerequisites

We recommend that readers consult the sections Understanding text and First steps to gain a deeper understanding of the summarized information presented in this text (History Tracers Editors. Understanding text ; History Tracers Editors. First steps).

Reflection

Have you ever asked yourself something like: "Why do I need to study this?" or "What can I do to avoid math?"
Have you ever said, "This is too difficult" without even trying? Or, "This is just a theory" without having the slightest idea what it's about?

If you have asked questions or made statements like these, it's possible that you have learned to memorize rather than to understand the underlying logic. In this section of History Tracers, we aim to expose the logic and the contradictory ideas behind the concepts we are presented with but do not always comprehend.
